author: MSNBC.com
title: Mark Cuban: 'If people can't afford to buy basic goods, there is no economy'
description: Billionaire Shark Tank investor and Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban on why he supports a federal minimum wage of $15/hour.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: Universal basic income is the solution to job loss
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi on how universal basic income will protect Americans as automation shrinks the workforce, especially those living paycheck-to-paycheck and without healthcare from their employers.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Tom Steyer: 'Under-resourced communities should be at the center of what we're doing'
description: Former presidential candidate and co-chair of California’s coronavirus taskforce Tom Steyer discusses his plans for a “fair, green and forward-looking” pandemic response.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Deb Haaland: Indigenous communities have been denied ‘the fundamental needs to live'
description: Democratic Rep. Deb Haaland of New Mexico, one of Congress’ only two Native American members, explains the disproportionate rates of coronavirus infection among the Navajo and other tribes.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Deval Patrick: ‘We have to understand that we're responsible for each other’
description: Former Mass. Democratic governor and presidential candidate Deval Patrick discusses the protests launched by Trump’s anti-lockdown tweets and why governors’ handling of the pandemic has been “the most hopeful thing.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Protesters fill streets of San Diego, demanding state's lockdown be lifted
description: Protesters of the stay-at-home order fill the streets of San Diego, Calif., with signs and flags demanding the lockdown measures be lifted. Many are concerned about the inability to work due to business closures.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NBC News/WSJ Poll: Nearly 60% of Americans support keeping stay-at-home restrictions
description: Nearly 60% of American voters say they are more concerned that a relaxation of stay-at-home restrictions would lead to more coronavirus deaths than they are that those restrictions will hurt the economy, according to NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Cuomo shuts down coronavirus hoax theories: 'Facts are facts'
description: During a press conference, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo shuts down conspiracy theories surrounding the coronavirus, and says "facts are facts."
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Cuomo on Massachussetts COVID-19 increase: We’re going to be there for you'
description: During a press conference, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo says Massachussetts may need 400 ventilators due to an increase of COVID-19 cases, and responds by saying "we're going to be there for you."
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Mayor de Blasio to Trump: 'Are you telling NYC to drop dead?'
description: During a press conference, Mayor Bill de Blasio calls on President Trump to help NYC recover from the coronavirus pandemic, and asks "are you telling NYC to drop dead?"
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NBC Poll: Majority of Americans disapprove of Trump's COVID-19 response
description: In a new NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll, a majority of Americans disapprove of President Donald Trump's handling of the coronavirus. 52% disapprove of Trump’s handling of the coronavirus, while 44% of voters say they approve.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Why many white workers agree with wealthy on reopening economy
description: Donald Trump's white working class voters apparently often align with GOP plutocrats on the president's coronavirus response, and the push to reopen the economy. Jane Mayer, staff writer at The New Yorker, joins Joy Reid to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'I haven't a whole meal on my table recently': Food banks face increased demand amidst pandemic
description: Lindsey Reiser reports from Newark, New Jersey where food banks are seeing increased demand amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Rep. Dean: Trump encourages governors to reopen at their peril
description: Donald Trump's coronavirus plan for states is critiqued by Rep. Madeleine Dean, who tells Joy Reid, 'We have to be guided by the science, and the humanity.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Top Democrats, Mnuchin close to next round of small business loan funding
description: Top Democrats and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said they were close to an agreement to a second round of funding for the small business loan program created in the prior coronavirus aid package.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Sen. Brown hopes pandemic will lead to tackling race disparities
description: Donald Trump's economic coronavirus response is critiqued by Sen. Sherrod Brown, who is working with his colleagues in the Senate to introduce legislation that can help everyday people financially survive the pandemic. Brown also discusses a potential VP
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Farmworkers fight for safety amid pandemic
description: Nicholas Gonzalez, spokesperson for #Masks4FarmWorkers and actor who portrays Dr. Neil Melendez on the TV series "The Good Doctor," joins MSNBC's Alicia Menendez to discuss the conditions America's farmworkers face.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fmr. HUD Secretary Castro: 'it’s time for us to see housing as a human right'
description: The COVID-19 outbreak has triggered a massive wave of layoffs across the country, leaving millions of Americans worried about how to pay their rent or mortgage.  MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez speaks with former Housing and Urban Development Secretary Julián Castro …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Study: Cattle industry could lose up to $13.6B due to coronavirus pandemic
description: NBC's Priscilla Thompson reports from Navasota, Texas, on the challenges the cattle industry is facing during the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: People of color, undocumented inordinately impacted by COVID-19
description: Communities of color are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19, in terms of infection rates and deaths. What can be done to address these disparities threatening the black, Native American, undocumented, and additional communities? Joy Reid and her panel di…
source.name: MSNBC

title: Small firms balk at chains getting small business relief funds
description: Coronavirus relief for small businesses has gone to many large businesses such as chain restaurants, according to reports. Joy Reid and her panel discuss the tiny firms who say they were pushed out of the small business bailout.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Anti-stay at home protests slammed for using civil rights lingo
description: Donald Trump voters are fueling protests against stay at home orders some states experts say, as these picketers are also slammed for evoking the black civil rights movement in the language of their demands. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Ryan defends monthly stimulus check proposal: 'Nobody bats an eye' when companies are bailed out
description: Rep. Tim Ryan defends his proposal to pay qualifying Americans $2,000 a month for the duration of the coronavirus pandemic, saying that nobody bats an eye when large corporations and industries such as airlines are bailed out.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Not all money is good': Atlantic City mayor says opening economy too early would be 'senseless'
description: Maura Barrett reports on how the coronavirus is affecting Atlantic City, New Jersey, and speaks to Mayor Marty Small, who says the economy cannot reopen until the coronavirus is under control.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rev. Al Sharpton on stay-at-home protests: 'This is not civil rights'
description: Reverend Al Sharpton defended his stance of not supporting in-person church gatherings during the COVID-19 crisis. Many are protesting the stay-at-home orders states have in place and some are suggesting that civil rights leadership get involved. Rev. Sharpto…
source.name: MSNBC
